results.title: Ready for the hills
results.creator_credit: Explorer Films, Maurice Dybeck and Peter Halket
results.brief_description: A training film on the basic essentials of hillcraft including training beforehand, blisters and the need for boots, type of anorak; windproof or waterproof, keeping together, the correct pace; how to walk, ascent and descent; the need for a leader, contrasts in weather conditions, food for lunch; emergency rations, drinking water and other refreshments, litter, first aid kit, map and compass, staying at youth hostels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Explorer Films, Maurice Dybeck and Peter Halket

results.title: Ready for action
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian news and Information Bureau, Forestry and Timber Bureau (Australia) and Jack Rogers
results.brief_description: Film trailer on bushfire prevention. Summer always brings the curse of fire. Photographed at a fire-control field day held at Wyong, N.S.W., this short film illustrates how firemen prepare for the threat of fire. They overhaul their organisation, communications equipment and gear; safeguard buildings before the fire season commences; practise in using fire-fighting equipment; construct fire-breaks and practice mopping up after a fire.

results.title: Ready and able
results.brief_description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.

results.title: Reading together
results.creator_credit: Jenni Taplin and Latrobe University. School of Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: Looks at the program being conducted at Reservoir East Primary School in which parents of children in infant grades are being encouraged to read with their children in order to facilitate the reading process. Show techniques that can used to stimulate reading. Narrated by Jeni Taplin. No other credits available.

results.title: Reading poetry: haiku
results.creator_credit: Arthur G. Evans, Oxford Films (U.S.) and John Mattias
results.brief_description: Teaches language structure, reading and writing of poetry. Presents three haiku with mood scenes of nature and young children playing as background for the reading of poetry. Shows the basic structure of three lines, totalling 17 syllables.

results.title: Reading planet
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description: Prism a young alien from the planet Reading is given the task of improving the reading skills of five earth students. Through their various adventures the audience is introduced to techniques such as deriving meaning from context, visualisation, etc.

results.title: Reading photographs
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
The works of specific photographers are examined to illustrate that visual communication carries more emotional, political and cultural impact than verbal communication. Warns the viewer to be aware of various visual stimuli.

results.title: Reading on
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Stephen Skok
results.brief_description: Follow up to “Beginning Reading” which looked at reading in the infant school. This program looks at strategies for the teaching of reading from Years 3-7. Practising clasroom teachers present their individual approaches for the teaching of reading at these levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Stephen Skok

results.title: Reading maps
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Designed for use in elementary social studies teaching, this film is an introduction to the study of maps, A young boy leans about the use of maps by following roads and by locating various places. He is shown how to read a map by observing the title, scale, direction symbols and legend.
